intro: Artemisia hultenii, commonly known as Hulten's wormwood, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments. It is part of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and contains essential oils that contribute to its strong, bitter scent. Artemisia hultenii is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for wildlife.
